column94: Ensure Ample Parking For Guests Was Provided When The Very Rude Volvo People Were On Site. Bring Bread Sooner At Meals.

column26: Other: Conducted Through A Business Partner
column61: Sadly The Food Took So So So Long To Come Out I Had Lost My Appetite. This Wasn't A One Off Problem  This Occurred All Weekend. After Placing The Order For Food On The Saturday Night At Around 7.30/8Pm  The Starters Didnt Arrive Until Gone 9Pm  Then The Mains Didnt Arrive Until Just Before 10Pm. There Was Little To No Atmosphere Within The Dining Room. Very Disappointing For The Prices We Paid
column88: Sadly The Bar Was Left Unmanned On Many Occasions And We As A Group (There Was About 7 Of Us) Had To Go Wondering Around The Hotel Looking For Someone.
column94: When We Arrived It Would Have Been Great To Find Out When Breakfast Was And Where Some Of The Facilities Within The Hotel Were. E.G Pool. We Thought This Was At The Spa  But Were Told When We Got There It Was In The Main Hotel.
column96: Do Not Change Towels Every Day. If There Was A Card Or Something I Could Have Used To Mark In My Room As To Whether I Wanted New Towels Or Not  That Would Have Been Great

column45: Lovely Room  But A Few Issues: - Bed Was A Little Uncomfortable - We Had To Ask Reception For Internet Connection Details - No Hot Water For Shower On Sat Night.
column61: As Ever  Fantastic Food (We Ordered From The Fine Dining Menu)  But There Were Some Real Service Problems On The Sat Night:  - We Had To Ask For Menus After A Long Wait. - We Then Had To Ask For The Fine Dining Menu (It Wasn't Offered). - We Had To Ask For A Wine Menu. - After 40 Minutes From When We Were Seated  We Had To Ask For Our Order To Be Taken. - Service Was Slow Throughout The Meal  But Improved When A More Senior Waitress Took Over Our Table.  This Was A Real Shame As We've Had Wonderful Meals On Previous Stays At Stapleford.  The Food Was Fantastic  But Was Sadly Spoiled By The Service.
column80: Great Facilities  Although More Chairs Around The Pool Would Be An Improvement.
column94: When We Checked Out  The Team Member Handling The Check-Out Didn't Ask Us How Our Stay Was - Disappointing...    Also  There Was An Error On Our Bill (Additional Drinks We Hadn't Ordered)  But This Was Quickly Rectified.
column95: Great To Be Back At Stapleford  But We Were Disappointed With The Sat Evening Dinner Experience.

column37: - Lovely Character Hotel Let Down By Very Slow And Poor Customer Service In The Restaurant And Bar - Don't Think Staff Have Been Correctly Recruited And Trained By Local Management. Food At Dinnner Was Average To Poor  Very Bland Including Real Lack Of Se
column61: - Lovely Character Hotel Let Down By Very Slow And Poor Customer Service In The Restaurant And Bar - Don't Think Staff Have Been Correctly Recruited And Trained By Local Management. Food At Dinnner Was Average To Poor  Very Bland Including Real Lack Of Se
column94: - Lovely Character Hotel Let Down By Very Slow And Poor Customer Service In The Restaurant And Bar - Don't Think Staff Have Been Correctly Recruited And Trained By Local Management. Food At Dinnner Was Average To Poor  Very Bland Including Real Lack Of Se

column61: The Meal We Had In The Main House In The Evening Was Wonderful With Great Service. However  The Meal We Had At The Pavillion At Lunchtime Was Very Poor. The Gentleman Who Served Us (Fairly Young  Reddish Tint Hair) Took Too Long To Take Our Orders  When We Asked What The Soup Of The Day Was He Couldn’T Remember And Then Said ‘Leek And Umm’ And Couldn’T Think What It Was And Our Party Said At The Same Time ‘Potato?’. A Soup Spoon Was Not Given To The Person Having Soup. Service Was So Slow I Had To Ask For My Main To Be Brought With The Starters As I Had A Treatment Booked In And Did Not Want To Miss It. This Did However Mean That I Missed Out On My Inclusive Dessert. I Would Expect Service At An Establishment Like Stapleford To Be Much Better Than This. Also  When Booking Treatments And Lunch When I Booked The Break  No-One Said That The Timings Would Be An Issue. If Lunch Is Going To Take 2+ Hours Then I Think You Should Let People Know So They Can Allow For This When Booking Golf/Spa Treatments.
column94: Our Bill Was A Nightmare. Instead Of Allocating Drinks And Deposits To Individual Rooms They Had All Been Put On One Bill. The Drinks On The Invoice Were Not Easy To Understand And So We Asked For It To Be Broken Down But This Was Also Difficult As There Were Several Mistakes And Things Debited And Then Credited. The Staff Did Eventually Work Out The Drinks Bill So That It Totalled That On The Invoice But We Still Had To Work Out Between Our Party Who Had What. This Took Us Over An Hour On The Sunday Morning And Was Not A Good Way To End What Had Been A Pleasant Break. The Attitude Was That If We Wanted Drinks Allocating In This Way Then We Should Have Asked But We Had Thought That Drinks And Individual Deposits Had Been Allocated To Rooms And If Any Different  We Should Have Been Asked How We Would Like The Bill At The Outset. We Asked Fort The Service Charge To Be Removed Because Of This Inconvenience.

column37: Arrival And Pre Arrival Contact Were All Very Professional
column61: Discussed With Annette The Duty Manager  Poor Dining Service Where We Were Left Alone In The Dining Hall For 30 Mins With No Staff
column88: Thought The New Lady From Latvia - We Did Not Catch Her Name Was Lovely

column61: The Service Was Disjointed  Slow And Somewhat Strange As The Staff Seem To Follow Eachother Around In A Beehive Effect. Some Retraining Required!

column37: We Stayed On A Monday And Were Not Told That The Gourmet Menu Was Not Available. We Were Even Phoned A Couple Of Days Befor Our Stay To Double Check On Any Dietary Restrictions  Yet All That Was Available Was The Casual House Menu  And No Efforts Had Been Made To Cater To Dietary Restrictions Leaving A Very Small Choice For Me.
column45: Lakeview. Windows Poorly Fitting  Leading To Wind Blowing Through  Also Rain Damage To Wallpaper Adjacent To Window. Very Cold  Only 2 Small Radiators. Although There Was An Electric Fan Heater I Didn't Like To Leave It On Whilst The Room Was Unoccupied Or When We Were In Bed. As The Room Is Quite Big This Meant The Fan Heater Had Little Effect In Warming The Room.
column61: We Waited 40 Minutes To Order Lunch  Only To Be Told That Lunch Had Now Finished And All We Could Have Was A Sandwich. Then Waited Another 40 Minutes For The Sandwich To Arrive. Waiters Too Busy Serving Afternoon Teas To Take Any Notice Of Us. Dinner In Grinling Gibbons - Gourmet Menu 'Off' Only House Menu Available. Restricted Choice For Vegetarian. Had To Ask 3 Times For Bread To Go With Soup. Waitress Couldn't Open Wine. When Asked If We Wanted Coffee In The Drawing Room We Were Left To Carry Our Not-Quite Finished Wine Glasses Ourselves And Then Ignored. No-One Came To Take Our Order For Coffee
column88: A South African Barman In The Library Was Very Pleasant And Chatty. Sorry  Don't Remember His Name. Pam (Hostess) Lovely As Ever. Unfortunately She Was Not On Duty On The Monday When We Had A Lot Of Problems
column94: It Was Very Cold (March)  With Snow On The Ground. Yet Fires Weren't Lit Until The Evening. The House Was So Cold During The Day I Considered Sitting In My Winter Coat. We Were Also Disappointed That The Pool Was Out Of Use As The Heater Was Broken. Whilst This Was Obviously Not Planned  I'm Informed This Happens Quite Frequently.
column95: Service Was So Bad I Considered Refusing To Pay The Service Charge  But The Actual Bar Staff/Waiters Etc Were Working Really Hard  And Trying Their Best. I Think They Were Poorly Trained  And Not Enough Staff Were Planned To Be At The Right Place At The Right Time. So I Paid The Service Charge  And Hope It Goes To The Right People.
column96: Improve Window Fitting - I Know It's A Listed Building But There Must Be Improvements Possible - Secondary Glazing? Even Draft Strips? Light The Fires During The Day - Burning Wood (Especially When Taken From Your Own Land) Is The Greenest Heating Possible  As Long As Trees Are Re-Planted.

column61: On Friday We Had To Wait 20 Minutes For A Dinner Before Dinner  Table Booked At 8.00 Got Menu After Asking Twice At 8.30 Shown To Table At 9.00 Food At 9.20. Asked For For Wine Twice Not Asked To Taste Wine Just Poured.  Never Asked If The Meal Was Ok. On Saturday Asked My Name On Too Occasions Not Shown A Menu For 30 Minutes. Wine Served Warm  Never Asked If Main Meal Was Ok. At Breakfast My Wife Used A Fork Of Fruit Put It On The Plate With The Spork  Waitress Picked Up The Plate When Finished Took Dirty Fork Off Plate And Put Back On The Tablecloth For Next Course.
column88: Did Discuss Issues With The Under Manager.
column94: When Ordering A Morning Tea And Coffee (As You Can Not Make In Room) The Night Before For 7.30 Am. Had To Ring On Phone System That Did Not Work. Drink Arrived At 8.15.
column95: For A Birthday Treat For Me And My Wife (As Birthday On Saturday And Sunday) I Would Say House Good  Food Good Service Shambolic. What Makes It Worse Is That Although I Had A Discussion With The Under Manager For Over 20 Minutes You Sent Me A Card Saying ' I Trust You Enjoyed Your Stay' We Also Talked To A Lady On Friday Who Had Got Married There The Year Before  She Came Into The Bar At 8.00 And Had Food At 10.00 She Said She Could Not Believe The Standards Could Drop That Far In A Year.

column45: Insufficient And Poor Lighting In The Bedroom. Extra Light Supplied When Requested. No Handles On The Bath To Assist In Pulling Yourself Up When In The Bath Or Getting In To Use The Shower. A Suction Handle Was Put In Place After Requested.
column61: In The Dining Room And In The Lounge The Serving Staff Did Not Know What They Were Doing. For Example On One Occassion In The Dining Room The Bread Did Not Arrive For 15 Minutes. In The Lounge For An Order Of Scones  A Sandwich And Coffee For 2 The Scones Arrived And Not Until I Asked What Was Going On Did The Rest Arrived. I Was Also No Impressed With The Quality Of Your Wines.
